title: They call it bubble letters
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095238im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gm_6445.jpg)

Looks like a standard font that's been stroked. But the curves on the letters are throwing me and the identifier software just can't get it from this logo. Kind of a 60's - 70's vibe, don't you think? My first time here, please be gentle. Thanks!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [gm.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095238/http:/typophile.com/files/gm.jpg) | 32.42 KB |
author: mactek360

comments.content:
Hobo, for everything except the |g|:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hobo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095238/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hobo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hobo/")

For the |g|, Geometric 415 (Bitstream’s version of Metro No. 2) works nicely:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095238/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/")

And yes, the vibe is very 60s or 70s (Hobo saw a resurgence in use at that time), but the typeface actually dates from 1910.
HOBO!! I knew I'd seen it somewhere before. Thanks so much!! (and Geometric.)
